column4: I got an email yesterday - "Announcing Ubuntu 4.10 (Release Candidate)" - but the version I already have is 4.10 - whats the deal with that?
there are updates and there will be updates until 4.10 will be final next week
well i can try in simple words
from where I get those updates?
from the internet
open an xterm
it is just another snapshot. more bugfixes
it is like preview with all the updates you got from the network until 2 days ago
there are people that can install only from CD
no. linux is not like windows :)
if you update from the network you get all of them
there is NO need to reinstall :-))
i installed my server approx 4 years ago...
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get upgrade
and since then i only upgraded it
yes. you can use synaptic
synaptic is sort of "only" a graphical frontend for apt-get
you can check the sources in /etc/apt/sources.list
if you want you can paste them to me in prvate and i will check them for you
if i will be around :-)
